item.title: Final Project
item.description: In this post, I’d like to introduce my final project: Covid-19 in US-case and individual level analysis. At the beginning of the project, we start with preparing the data. There are four major part of the data our projects: policy data, hospital data, individual data as well as population data. The data I collected is population data from United States Census Bureau, American Community Survey 1-Year Data (2005-2019). This dataset includes state level population data, describing the number of cases of female/male under each group for each state.

item.title: Classfication of Insects Images by Deep Learning
item.description: In this post, i’d like to give a description of how I train a deep larning model to classify insects: beetles, cockroaches and dragonflies with given train and test sets of images. Firstly, I read few of the images randomly, and theses images have different sizes. For coinvenience, I transformed them into the same size, then tranformed images into np.array After the transformation from image into np.array, the shape of the train/test dataset should be same as the numbers of images under each file in the original image folder:

item.title: My First Streamlit app
item.description: In this post I will describe how I used streamlit to generate a simple app for my visualization of data of PhDs awarded in the US from website(https://ncses.nsf.gov/pubs/nsf19301/data). Firstly, I used python to open the excel file I downloaded (Doctorate recipients from U.S. colleges and universities: 1958–2017). And I replaced the ‘-’ into 0 for the first of the change rate column since the first year doesn’t has previous year. I display the table on the app and it looks like this:

item.title: Starwars
item.description: In this post, I’d like to give a short description of how I scrapped star wars’ api and find the oldest person (or robot or alien) and list the titles of all the films they appeared in by using Python. The first step is using function ‘requests’ to scrub the data from the ‘people’ section star wars’ api since the information I want to know is about the people appeared in the movies.

item.title: SQLite Schema
item.description: In this post, i’d like to share how I created a SQLite3 schema to store this data in at least 3rd normal form (3NF), and then populated the tables. And I also use SQL query to find the names of all playlists that contain instrumentals. First I saved the csv file as a pandas dataframe in Python, then I created 6 seperated dataframes bansed on it: Track, Album, Playlist_namne, Playlist_genre, Playlist, and Other.

item.title: Visualization
item.description: In this post, I will focus on how I visualized three datasets about Malaria Death. The first dataset is called malaria_deaths, it includes the data of Malaria deaths by country for all ages across the world and time. It has variables named as “Entity”, “Code”, “Year”, “Deaths - Malaria - Sex: Both - Age: Age-standardized (Rate) (per 100,000 people)”; “Code” refers to the country code, and I renamed the last one as “Death_Rate” for future convenience.

item.title: Euler Problems
item.description: Problem 1: Dice Game (Problem 205, solved by 14,219) Peter has nine four-sided (pyramidal) dice, each with faces numbered 1, 2, 3, 4. Colin has six six-sided (cubic) dice, each with faces numbered 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6. Peter and Colin roll their dice and compare totals: the highest total wins. The result is a draw if the totals are equal. What is the probability that Pyramidal Pete beats Cubic Colin?

item.title: How to use Hugo to build my first blog
item.description: The first moment that I saw the requirement of homework, which is designing my own website, I was really nervous: because I thought it would be extremely difficult for me to design a website within a week. But I realized it would be an interesting experience when I looked at the instruction of Hugo. I followed the steps, and I had fun playing with the theme — Ananke. Ananke is one of the most widely used theme in Hugo, and it is also the theme used in the instruction.
